item.title: Docs: Visual Studio Code
item.description:
VS Code is a code editor redefined and optimized for building and debugging modern web and cloud applications. It includes support for debugging, embedded Git control and GitHub, syntax highlighting, intelligent code completion, snippets, and code refactoring.

Download from https://code.visualstudio.com/

Recommended Extensions

  • Azure Account (Microsoft)
  • Azure Repos (Microsoft)
  • markdownlint (David Anson)
  • Markdown Preview Mermaid Support (Matt Bierner)
  • GitLens (Eric Amodio)
  • Kubernetes (Microsoft)
  • Docker (Microsoft)

item.title: Docs: Windows Subsystem for Linux
item.description:
The Windows Subsystem for Linux lets developers run a GNU/Linux environment – including most command-line tools, utilities, and applications – directly on Windows, unmodified, without the overhead of a virtual machine.

We recommend installing Ubuntu 18.04 LTS.

Follow the Windows Subsystem for Linux Installation Guide for Windows 10 to install a Linux distrubtion on your machine.
